Mushroom brunch

By Miriam Nice
  • 1
  • 2
  • 3
  • 4
  • 5
(19 ratings)
By Miriam Nice
Magazine subscription – 5 issues for £5

Prep: 5 mins Cook: 12 mins - 15 mins

Easy

Serves 4

You only need mushrooms, eggs, kale and garlic to cook this tasty one-pan brunch. It's comforting yet healthy, low-calorie and gluten-free too

Share:
  • Facebook
  • Pinterest
  • Twitter
  • Google+
  • Email

Nutrition and extra info

  • Healthy
  • Gluten-free
  • Vegetarian

Nutrition: Per serving

  • kcal154
  • fat11g
  • saturates2g
  • carbs1g
  • sugars1g
  • fibre2g
  • protein13g
  • salt0.4g
Save to My Good Food
Please sign in or register to save recipes.
Print
  • Ingredients
  • Method

Ingredients

  • 250g mushrooms

    Mushroom

    mush-room

    The mushroom is a fungus which comes in a wide range of varieties that belong to two distinct…

  • 1 garlic clove
  • 1 tbsp olive oil

    Olive oil

    ol-iv oyl

    Probably the most widely-used oil in cooking, olive oil is pressed from fresh olives. It's…

  • 160g bag kale

    Kale

    kay-el

    A member of the cabbage family, kale comes in two forms: kale, which has smooth leaves, and…

  • 4 eggs

    Egg

    egg

    The ultimate convenience food, eggs are powerhouses of nutrition packed with protein and a…

Method

  1. Slice the mushrooms and crush the garlic clove. Heat the olive oil in a large non-stick frying pan, then fry the garlic over a low heat for 1 min. Add the mushrooms and cook until soft. Then, add the kale. If the kale won’t all fit in the pan, add half and stir until wilted, then add the rest. Once all the kale is wilted, season.

  2. Now crack in the eggs and keep them cooking gently for 2-3 mins. Then, cover with the lid to for a further 2-3 mins or until the eggs are cooked to your liking. Serve with bread.

Recipe from Good Food magazine, November 2017

Comments, questions and tips

Sign in or create your My Good Food account to join the discussion.
  • Comments (3)
  • Questions (2)
  • Tips (0)
Rebecca Day
21st Apr, 2020
5.05
So enjoyed this. Also added a handful of cherry tomatoes with the garlic and mushrooms. And drizzled some sriracha/olive oil dressing!
Ruth Kay
25th Nov, 2018
5.05
Delicious and very simple. Seemed to take a longer time to cook than stated. I havled the ingredients for 2 people.
catie74
18th Feb, 2018
5.05
This taste remarkably good for something so simple. Nice served with some bacon too
VKong Bear
22nd Apr, 2020
Can spinach be substituted for the kale?
Esther_Deputyfo...
22nd Apr, 2020
Hey, Esther from the food team here! Yes spinach would be a great substitute for the kale! Thanks for your question.

Skills & know how

As well as helping you decide what to cook we can also help you to cook it. From tips on cookery techniques to facts and information about health and nutrition, we’ve a wealth of foodie know how for you to explore.

See our how to section...

About BBC Good Food

We are the UK’s number one food brand. Whether you’re looking for healthy recipes and guides, family projects and meal plans, the latest gadget reviews, foodie travel inspiration or just the perfect recipe for dinner tonight, we’re here to help.

Our recipes

All our recipes are tested thoroughly by us to make sure they’re suitable for your kitchen at home. We know many of you are concerned about healthy eating, so we send them to a qualified nutritionist for thorough analysis too.

Start browsing our recipes now

Love the new look or think we’ve missed the mark? We want to hear your thoughts – good and bad – to make sure we make the new website as useful as possible.
